spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall zoning (living/dining to the right, bedrooms along the bottom band, kitchen near the top-center) is roughly similar, but multiple critical layout mismatches exist: the large living-room window is placed on the wrong exterior wall; the right-side exterior connection/door location does not match; several interior partitions and openings in the central hall/bath/closet area do not align with the 2D plan; and room proportions (living vs kitchen enclosure and hall widths) appear distorted.

structural_fidelity.notes: Adjacencies are partially preserved (kitchen adjacent to dining/living; two bathrooms present; two bedrooms present), but structural fidelity is undermined by hallucinated stepped/platform elements, incorrect exterior opening placement on the right wall, and inconsistent interior wall/door embedding compared to the plan. At least one closet/utility partitioning near the entry/coat area does not match the 2D layout.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture is plausible but not plan-faithful: kitchen casework shape differs from the L-shaped plan; living seating arrangement and rug placement do not match the 2D configuration; bedroom furniture placement/orientation is simplified and does not clearly follow the plan’s bed/wall relationships. Scale appears generally consistent, but some circulation clearances are unrealistic compared to the plan.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Render is clean and readable with good lighting and generally consistent isometric presentation. Minor issues: slight perspective/orthographic ambiguity (reads as perspective isometric rather than strict axonometric), and some geometry (doors/wall junctions) looks stylized rather than architecturally exact.

detected_errors.description: Living-room large window wall is incorrect: 2D plan shows the long window on the top/north wall of the living area; 3D places the dominant window on the right/east exterior wall.

Missing/incorrect exterior door to Chandler & Joey’s apartment: the 2D plan indicates an exterior door on the right wall near the living room; the 3D does not clearly show this door in the correct location/orientation.
Hallucinated stepped/platform element in the left-side interior (tiered steps/raised structure) that is not present anywhere in the 2D floor plan.
Central hall/entry partitioning deviates: interior wall runs and room openings around the entry/closet/bath core do not align with the 2D plan’s geometry.
Several door swing/orientations are inconsistent with the plan (notably around the central hall and bathroom entries), reducing functional fidelity.

Proportion distortion: kitchen appears more enclosed and reshaped (U/peninsula feel) versus the plan’s L-shaped counters and openness; hall widths and room aspect ratios differ from the 2D proportions.
Bedroom window placement appears inconsistent with the 2D plan (plan indicates bedroom windows along the bottom/south exterior wall; 3D shows differing window positions/visibility).
